id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

items¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶

user¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

orderitem_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

user¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

store.views.add_to_cart(request, product_id)[source]¶

Add a product to the session cart or increment its quantity.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • product_id (int) – The ID of the product to add.

Returns:

Redirect to the cart view.

Return type:

HttpResponseRedirect

store.views.checkout(request)[source]¶

Process the checkout and create an order from the cart.

If POST, creates an Order and associated OrderItems, then clears the cart.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered checkout confirmation or checkout form.

Return type:

HttpResponse

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

HttpResponse

store.views.product_detail(request, slug)[source]¶

Display details for a single product and handle cart addition.

If the request is POST, the product is added to the session cart.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • slug (str) – The unique slug identifying the product.

Returns:

Rendered product detail page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Return type:

HttpResponse
